@graph.title: Herman Zeinstra - projects and methods
abstract: Material narratives: observations on craftsmanship, art, and making a city / Christoph Grafe -- Interview with Herman Zeinstra / Jaapjan Berg and Jan Peter Wingender -- Experiments 1975-2015 / Herman Zeinstra -- The design method -- Reason for existence and right to exist of the building -- The desire for craftsmanship and inventiveness -- Desires for unity, cohesion and individuality -- Examples, samples and images -- The desire for beauty, the necessity of beauty -- The quality of the space is determined by the quality of its boundaries -- Stand and steps -- Material: potentials and limitations -- Material and light -- Architecture, an art of reality and image -- Longing for architecture

House Oude Schans 3 -- Residential building Bleekerwegje -- 8 apartments Kort Spaarne -- 2 Office buildings 'Noordpoort'-- 10 Homes 'Kruidveld'-- Funeral home -- 99 single family homes Sporenburg -- Crematorium -- Residential building Timorplein and surroundings -- 32 sheltered housing units -- Telephone exchange 'KPN' Ijburg -- Opera International competition -- 29 houses and 53 apartments Blok 30 Ijburg -- 141 houses and 16 apartments Blok 20 Ijburg -- Great Egyptian Museum International competition -- Museum for Realism -- Residential building Delflandplein -- Crematorium and cemetery -- List of works -- Collaborators -- Awards
Monograph on Amsterdam based architect and teacher Herman Zeinstra who is influential for a lifelong generation of Dutch architects and planners
